content.raw:
My guess is that when we have `patch_radius` as `0`,  the [rhs](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/228f9e8990f995f913e6bfc9a34d966b6593aa95/deps/opende/src/joints/contact.cpp?at=torsional_friction_john#contact.cpp-367) is `0`, so the `lo` and `hi` are `0`.  
A possibility is we still solve for `torsional_force` as a nonzero value, and it was not truncated correct by the lower and upper bound.  
I cannot test it now, since I got a complain about `missing element description for [torsional]`
content.html:
My guess is that when we have patch_radius as 0, the rhs is 0, so the lo and hi are 0.
A possibility is we still solve for torsional_force as a nonzero value, and it was not truncated correct by the lower and upper bound.
I cannot test it now, since I got a complain about missing element description for [torsional]
